titleStmt.title: H. S. Johnson et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2339

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To the Honerable
Judge of the Mason County Court

Your petitioners would Respectfully recomend. John T. Wilson as a Suitable person -- to fill the unexpired term. accosioned by the death of Charles A Burgess -- as Justice of the peace, of the Mays lick district No 7,
Being acquainted with Wilsons' qualifications -- Yourself few petititoners are only necessary

H, S. Johnsons
John Smalls
Thos W. Wheatly
J, M, Piper
J W Williams
Willis Berry
Geo Myall
Micheal M. Walton
John Fields
R. H Lassuns
Jonas Myall
Edwd Myall
A S Wilson
W T Payen
A F Wililson
Stephen H Carnegy
D, D, Allen
A W Peed
H. C. Liter
Wm F Chanslor
J V Mitchell
Jos W. Howe
R. B. Yancey
B. C Warden
Jno H Worthington
John T. Linmate
T A Palmer
Ben D Parry
P. O. Palmer.
P Laytham
Joseph S Coale
William Butler
Preston Tyler
C G. Worthington
E. H. Herndon
Joseph Trotman
Thos P Hopper
J P Ben Laytham
Cornelius Waller
W. H Arthur
G W Wells
R J Gaither
J A Jackson
Nathaniel Raffe

We the above: Petitioner would Respectfully ask You to recomd John T. Wilson For the Office of Justice of the Peace bilieving you can do so. Knowing his qualifications --. This I am warranted in saying -- Knowing the wishes of the People

Judg Savage.
To This Excelency Gov Bramblett
